summary: A fairy tale adventure about a beautiful young woman and her one true love. He must find her after a long separation and save her. They must battle the evils of the mythical kingdom of Florin to be reunited with each other. Based on the William Goldman novel "The Princess Bride" which earned its own loyal audience.

reviews.content: The Princess Bride is an incredible classic romance movie mixed with just the right amount of comedy and satire. The producers and actors are able to twist a "damsel in distress" film and make it into something extraordinary that never fails to keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Cary Elwes and Robin Wright envelop every part of their characters gracefully and indulge the audience in sweet romance. While Mandy Patinkin plays Inigo swiftly and effortlessly and Wallace Shawn portrays Vizzini who gives the film an idiotic yet comedic environment. Unknowingly becoming an outstanding movie of its time The Princess Bride continues to captivate younger viewers even today.
My family's favorite movie of all time. It has everything! Love it
A classic movie with great characters and story. It has humor action and is a love story. This is a movie you wish for if you get stranded on a deserted island.
There isn't much to say that hasn't already been said about The Princess Bride. It's a film for everyone that is both uniquely hilarious and warmly romantic.

A whimsical cult classic which aged. Fun, especially the first time through, but the jokes start to fall flat as realization dawn's that many of those jokes couldn't slip by modern cultural sensibilities. The hero overcomes numerous obstacles - even death! - and suffers thoroughly for an ungrateful damsel whose sole motive remains her selfishness right through to the end. Yet the hero's love never falters, despite her numerous faults and questionable virtue, and he wins(?) fair lady's love and hand at the end. More's the pity.
A great classic movie
My wife and I love this movie to bits, its the best, it brings the nostalgia of when we were kids.

The greatest movie of all time. I have seriously seen it over 20 times. 

Much of the dialogue is quotable and the characters are marvelous. 

When I said "the greatest of all time", I do know what that means. And typos are because I have 6 fingers on my right hand. 

It is inconceivable to rate this movie less than a 5.

Definitely one of those cult classics that I definitely recommend you to take a look at and watch. It's very corny and cheesy, and the characters are very goofy and over the top. It's not a film that I will suggest to re-watch on a regular bases unless you are just one of those pulp followers for this film. But I definitely was not. I watch this film for the first time in 2022 and I have not revisited it.
A strikingly crisp and well-paced piece of entertainment.  Extra half star for the false flag element ;)
One of the greatest.
This movie has some of the best storytelling out there. The characters feel so fun and classic, like something out of a fairytale—great film, all in all, missing out if you haven't watched it.
Truly the closest thing to a perfect movie that exists in our world.
A true classic that everyone should watch!

Besides the kissing, I actually enjoyed this one and watched it at normal speed. The protagonists were likable, the villains villainous, and unlike the others I watched around the same time, it felt like stuff actually happened.

A light-heart tale taking a jab at fairy tales. Very funny with many great lines! You'll find yourself repeating them many times and rewatching to get more! One of the best movies I've seen, my family all over it.

Wandered how it achieved its cult following in the first 15 or so minutes but then it grew in me,it was charming sweet and fun and it showed a side to several of the actors we probably did not get to see again.Andre the giant was especially good and it brought back childhood memories
A rom-com that audiences of all kinds can enjoy with timeless characters, humor, settings and storytelling.

I watched it because it is referenced in so many other books and movies, but it really sucked. There's no story, no characters, no humor, just some stereotypes mixed together. It was dull and problematic. Where's the romance in here, why is it considered romantic? One must really believe in Love At First Sight and True Love in order to enjoy this movie.
It's one of those very kid-friendly romps that adults can also easily invest in. Features many isms of old "Golden Age" Hollywood in a very 80's way (if that makes any sense).
Literally my favourite movie of all time. It has everything one must want for in a movie
An amazing and wonderful classic fairy tale type movie with a slightly modern edge to it.
This is WAYYYYYYYYYY overrated its cheesy and not good
As charming as it is funny. A stellar cast
A wonderful romantic action movie. Lots of quotable moments and funny jokes.
Remember when H0LLYW00D Made Movies of This Caliber?

Princess Bride is something that is really special. It is well designed, well directed and well acted. Rob Reiner is a very good director indeed, directing films like Stand By Me and all that. The film itself is beautiful, with lovely sets and costumes, matched with a funny and touching script, not to mention quotable. The story was simple, but very well-developed, with a few surprises here and there. As for the acting, it is superb. Cary Elwes is a very charismatic lead as Westley, and Robin Wright gives a very spirited performance as Princess Buttercup. Chris Sarandon is a little annoying, but he has some delicious throw-away lines, so you warm to him, especially when Westley insults him at the end. Wallace Shawn, Andre the Giant and Christopher Guest(who bares a mere resemblance to Tim Curry's Cardinal Richelieu) were very good too, as is an unrecognisable Billy Crystal. And Mandy Patinkin is deliciously hammy as the man who wishes to avenge his father's death by killing his six-fingered murderer. But what impressed me most were the funny interruptions with the grandfather(played wonderfully by Colombo's Peter Falk)and his sick grandson(Fred Savage). All in all, an original and funny movie that is a must see. 9.5/10 Bethany Cox.
greatest comedy film of all time
The movie is cute. I wouldn't give it a 97% though. 80% is more like it.

I was introduced to this masterpiece at University by a housemate who I will forever be endebted to for this introduction. There's a shortage of perfect films in this world....this is one of them.  I have just had the privilege of introducing my nieces and nephew to this masterwork they range from 5 to 18 - they all loved it - it has everything ...Fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles...and operates on so many levels that there is something for everyone.
6 years ago-Hilarious, witty, fantasy that makes a love story seem fresh. Plus, the best sword fight in cinematic history
It's perfect.  No one should EVER attempt to reboot or remake this film.
Honestly really wished my family had owned this when I was younger, probably would of watched it hundreds of times.
Perfect combination of action, comedy, campiness and silly romance for a comedy movie.  This is a must see for anyone

Although my opinion could be clouded by nostalgia, I harbor such a deep love for this movie. Just the right amount of self-aware to be funny and not totally lose the storyline. I have forced this movie upon as many people as humanly possible and I do not intend to stop.
Awesome all time favourite, jam packed with memorable lines.
Its a great, funny, and original must see movie
It has everything - action, love, fun, magic, beautiful landscapes and music. Just perfection.
The best thing about the movie is that the dvd cover reads the title upside down and right side up

An absolutely timeless movie filled with wonder, laughs, tears, and of course romance! I can watch this again and again, and it doesn't matter how much time passes, it is timeless. I always pull something different out of it depending on what mood I am in. I highly recommend this classic!

You know you have a favorite movie on your hands when you go out of your way to show it to as many people as possible. In high school, I must have shown this film to about a dozen people who had never seen it before. Where was I going with this? Oh yeah! The Princess Bride is amazing!
The characters are all charming, the cast have fantastic chemistry with each other, the dialogue is witty, the action is exciting, the comedy is clever, the score is suitably cheesy, and the framing device is relatable.
You can nitpick this movie all you want, but the more you do, in my humble opinion, the more I'm convinced you are a heartless monster who has no concept of fun.
This movie is so fun, witty, and clever that it manages to turn its cheapness into an asset. That alone is commendable and one of the many reasons why this is one of my all-time favorites!

The Princess Bride is a timeless classic that is enjoyable after re-watching numerous times. Funny, heartwarming, exciting, and full of memorable quotes, this will always be one of my favorite movies.
LOL, lots of kissing scenes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Even the most virulent contrarian would be hard-pressed to find legitimate fault with Rob Reiner's The Princess Bride.  Written by William Golding and faithfully based on his timeless novel, the film follows the true love romance between the beautiful Princess Buttercup (Robin Wright) and her doggedly persistent suitor Westley (Cary Elwes).  Filled with drama, suspense, comedy, action and, of course, romance, it is packed with wonderful characters, iconic dialogue, solid performances from top to bottom from a fantastic cast, an effective score from Dire Straits front man Mark Knopfler, and enough nods to the swashbuckling films from decades earlier to keep audiences entranced from start to finish.  This could well be one of the most consistently entertaining films ever made.
I've been raised on this movie. I reference it all the time. It's so iconic that I can't imagine anyone not seeing it.
This was a great movie.  👍
Possibly the best film ever made. Such a delight, full of whimsy, humour, adventure, and of course: true love. I watch it every year and it never gets old.

A classic that I've seen bits and pieces of throughout the years but only now decided to watch it in its entirety. It's certainly unique, quotable, clever, charming, funny, and above all else entertaining. I didn't love it top-to-bottom, but I'm glad I finally saw the whole thing.

R.I.P. 'Andre The Giant'.

Princess Bride is something that is really special. It is well designed, well directed and well acted. Rob Reiner is a very good director indeed, directing films like Stand By Me and all that. The film itself is beautiful, with lovely sets and costumes, matched with a funny and touching script, not to mention quotable. The story was simple, but very well-developed, with a few surprises here and there. As for the acting, it is superb. Cary Elwes is a very charismatic lead as Westley, and Robin Wright gives a very spirited performance as Princess Buttercup. Chris Sarandon is a little annoying, but he has some delicious throw-away lines, so you warm to him, especially when Westley insults him at the end. Wallace Shawn, Andre the Giant and Christopher Guest(who bares a mere resemblance to Tim Curry's Cardinal Richelieu) were very good too, as is an unrecognisable Billy Crystal. And Mandy Patinkin is deliciously hammy as the man who wishes to avenge his father's death by killing his six-fingered murderer. But what impressed me most were the funny interruptions with the grandfather(played wonderfully by Colombo's Peter Falk)and his sick grandson(Fred Savage). All in all, an original and funny movie that is a must see. 9.5/10 Bethany Cox.

I feel like with a lot of these movies from the '80s that are insanely popular and nostalgic, I feel like I completely missed the boat and don't find much of anything to enjoy about it (lookin' at you, Labyrinth).

I'm happy to say Princess Bride is not one of those movies! I actually really enjoyed seeing this for the first time in college seven-ish years ago and rewatching it tonight for this review. On a film-as-a-work-of-art level, this movie really suffers. The production design is pretty cheap, the cinematography is fine at best and pretty uninspired at worst, and the score is pretty cheesy all the way around. That being said, though, the tone is what makes Princess Bride works-at no point does this movie want you to take it seriously and that's why it has endured so well.

The screenplay and comedic performances are where Princess Bride really shines. There are so many iconic lines and bits in the film, it would be futile to try to compile the list here of times I smiled or laughed. The ensemble cast was full of lovable characters spouting iconic lines of dialogue, definitely worth revisiting again and again. I have to point out the child acting performance of the boy who played the boy being read the story. His line delivery was pitch-perfect, and I laughed out loud more than a few times at his running commentary on the story.

This movie is so fun and I adore it, but as a finished product of cinema, I've definitely seen better. But that definitely doesn't mean I don't love it.
One of the best movies I have ever seen and can enjoy with my 5 year old son or 70 year old mother.
I liked it, it was pretty good and very quotable
Greatest movie of all time. AAAASSSS YOOOOOOUUUUU WIIIIIIISSSSSHHHHHHH!!!!

Rob Reiner's The Princess Bride is a great film that defies categorization.  It's a fairy tale, romance, action adventure, comedy and a buddy film, all in one.  And "comedy" doesn't begin to describe the biting satire, word-play and slapstick.  Of course, Reiner deserves only half the credit, because his film brings to life this unusual, inventive story and screenplay by William Goldman.  Cary Elwes and Robin Wright are perfectly cast, and Many Patinkin deserves special kudos for his outstanding performance.

For me The Princesses Bride is too slow moving and doesn't have the fairytale like traits to it to make it memorable for me this isn't my cup of tea it would have been in nice to have Jerry Goldsmith or James Horner to score the film but they got rock star Mark Knopfler to do the music and that doesn't fly well under my radar.
Meh, didn't really live up to the hype. Maybe it just wasn't for me. Definitely could've lived without seeing this one.
this show has incredible charecters and great story with a lot of comedy, and i do'n't know if they meant to make it funny, but whatever they did it seemed to be hillaroiuse
one of the funniest films of all time!
Not sure how there can be a better movie.  The perfect action/adventure/comedy based on a book that is of the same perfection.  The only gripe are the cut scenes where the grandfather is reading.
Classic. Gets better with repeated viewings. Humour is spot on.
Genuinely one of the best fairy-tale movies of all time. An excellent cast, great effects, hilarious jokes, and compelling storyline make this a classic that should not be missed.

Light hearted and whimsical fairy tale. Pure in nature and light on a plot. Great soundtrack. Captivating characters, played brilliantly by all the actors. But it just feels lacking and barely imaginative. The framing device of it being a fairy tale being read to a sick boy is barely used. I didn't grow up on it, so I can not in good faith recognize it, as something iconic just by the word of mouth.

"Life is pain, Highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something."

Would you guys believe me if I told you that I haven't seen The Princess Bride until now. For years I was surrounded by people who would reference this regularly and man I was so confused. And yes, every iconic scene and quotes flew over my head.

But not anymore. I've seen it...I liked it a lot.

Feels great to join the club.

Brilliant...the characters are fully drawn, the dramatic tension is amazing, and it is such a heart-warming story of true love, loyalty, and the ultimate believe (not wrong) that good and justice will prevail.
I loved ALL the great characters, but Billy Crystal steals it!

A classic tale of fantasy with tongue-in-cheek humor placed throughout -- all told from the perspective of a grandfather reading to his sick grandson -- it is a beautiful blend of satire and sincerity that I believe few films have been able to achieve.

Rob Reiner has made classics that live in our minds such as Stand By Me, Misery, and my personal favorite (though flawed but friendly) Flipped. Among many others, I have never seen The Princess Bride. Inconceivable! On top of this, with all honesty, I was not looking forward to see it whatsoever. INCONCEIVABLE! Boy was I proven wrong. The Princess Bride hit my soft spot with romantic comedies and fairytale stories. If there is something that sets it apart from other fairytale films, it's its comedy. The film is downright hilarious and vividly entertaining. Not one single boring moment; just a nice movie with family and friends. Also, the back and forth with Fred Savage adds a nice touch and reminds us why we love bedtime stories.
This movie is a crowning achievement by all involved, I love this Movie thus the five star rating!!!!!

I had forgotten how great this was until I rewatched it. Definitely a fun classic with great performances and a fun story.

Highly Recommend.
I can't believe I waited this long to watch this. I had always heard good things and it lived up to the hype. This was so much fun.
The comedy and cynicism were hilarious. You could make a prequel movie just from Wesley's story of the mantle of "The Dread Pirate Roberts".
A hilarious, quotable film filled with memorable characters and solid writing, The Princess Bride is a fun, timeless fairy tale movie that the entire family can enjoy.
Phenomenal movie. #1 favorite for many. Slept on this one, whoops. Andre The Giant steals the show.
while i might enjoy the princess bride less if i didn't have so much nostalgia for it, i still think this is the best american live-action fantasy movie ever made

It's a simple yet beautiful and somewhat humourus storybook love story. 

Andre the Giant's best role. A human tale. 

Recommended.
The book is better but the film has its charm as well. I recommend looking up the trivia and behind the scenes.
Cheesy but lovably cheesy in the best way. The Princess Bride takes it’s classic tale of damsel in distress and makes it refreshingly funny and highly entertaining.

A classic that I've watched my whole life. We're watching the movie through the imagination of the sick child listening to his Grandfather's novel, and once the story gets rolling we enter a world of adventure, romance, trickery, and flamboyant fighting. The way the story can take the viewer away so swiftly into this fantasy world is basically what films are made to do and although gimmicky it does it really well. As a child I'd think about certain scenes over and over again, especially the screaming eels lol.
For me it was like a mixture of Yesilcam's movies that I grew up with and the Monty Python. However, it is not the mixture of best aspects.

A cult classic that stands the test of time. One could argue that Princess Buttercup could use a dose of agency, but this film remains one of the most memorable and quotable works ever to appear on screen. It's more than a feel-good romance or rousing adventure story. It's cinematic history.

The movie I've rewatched more than any other. Even more than any holiday or superhero movies or Star Wars, Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, Pixar, or Studio Ghibli movies. It is not only a classic but also THE PERFECT MOVIE. All movie creators should watch this to know what a good movie looks like before proceeding with their projects. I feel no need to explain myself if you've already seen it, and if you haven't then there is something very wrong.
Maybe it's good for little kids. But if you critics think THIS is good.... I am never listening to you all again.
It's just a great classic.
Perhaps my favorite movie of all time. Love it even + 30 years later.

I often wonder how much I would love this movie if someone like John Williams had provided the score. I understand that the music in there now is meant to be intentionally cheesy and old fashioned, but I can't help but think this otherwise charming and fun movie would absolutely soar with a different musical approach.
Might be a little funny but it is not worthy at all.
Perhaps the greatest movie of all time. A go to feel good movie with a little bit for everyone and more than enough for anyone.
When it's my turn to pick a movie to watch with the kids, this is the one I will probably choose. The Princess Bride is a sweet fairytale that it never gets old.

The Princess Bride may have a ridiculous title like that of a crappy Netflix rom-com, but manages to be very funny, memorable, whimsical, and action-packed as well. Though it does fall flat sometimes, The Princess Bride is very effective at being a delightful, swashbuckling fantasy romance.
I loved this movie so much as a young girl that to this day, I can speak the entire script line by line from memory. If you haven't seen it, you don't know movies.
This film has to be in the top 100 films to see before you die.

A childhood classic.

laud this movie for its straightforwardness.

Another quarantine film appreciation class with my kids was a hit ("Labyrinth" also got a thumbs-up. "E.T." got a Meh). From writer William Goldman ("Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid" "All the Presidents Men" "Misery") and director Rob Reiner ("This is Spinal Tap" "Stand by Me" "When Harry Met Sally" and also "Misery") comes a very subversive fairy tale send-up. It's charming and wimiscal enough that the kids will love it and it's witty and subversive that adults will love it even more so. What makes this parody film unique is that while Goldman and Reiner are certainly poking fun at fairy tale tropes, they also tell a fairy tale with genuine charm and sweetness. Compared to other parody films like "Blazing Saddles" or "Airplane" which are entirely mocking and ridicule, "The Princess Bride" is at its heart is still a fairy tale love story. I won't bother summarizing the story, since I'm assuming everyone has already watched this film, but "The Princess Bride" boasts a stellar cast, led by then unknown Cary Elwes ("Robin Hood: Men in Tights" "Glory" "Days of Thunder" "Stranger Things") and Robin Wright ("Forrest Gump" "Moneyball" "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo" "House of Cards"). The scene stealing supporting cast has SO many iconic moments! Wallace Shawn shouting "Inconceivable!" and the battle of wits face-off. Peter Cook's speech impaired clergyman. Mel Smith's throat clogged Albino. Carol Kane and Billy Crystal as the bickering Valerie and Miracle Max. Mandy Patinkin's Inigo Montoya is the main standout in the cast, who's performance still gave me chills when he has his final confrontation with Christopher Guest's six-fingered Count Rugen. Patinkin brings a level of emotion to the film that brings unexpected depth and heart. Then there's the enormous André the Giant, who pretty much steals every scene he's in. I also usually dislike wraparound  or story bookends, but Fred Savage and  Peter Falk are wonderful as a grandfather and grandson reading the story together, which affords lots of opportunities for commentary on the story and to even skip over the boring parts. The film's Once-Upon-A-Time feel is greatly aided is a lush score by Mark Knopfler of Dire Straits and beautiful  photography by Adrian Biddle ("Aliens" "Thelma & Louise" "V for Vendetta") that gives the film a timeless feel. On the downside, the film's villains seem underdeveloped and not all that interesting. Also, the film does have some pacing issues where the story drags a bit at times. Still, those are minor quibbles for a film that really does deserve its status as a classic film that both kids and adults (for different reasons) will enjoy. FUN FACT: André the Giant called almost everybody on set (be they director, producers, co-stars or crew) "boss", a technique he employed to defer to people he liked and go some way towards counteracting the way he would tower over them.

Easily one of my all-time favorite movies and not just just because I read and loved the odd book upon which it was based when I was a kid. It's full of memorable quotes, great actors, a beautiful princess, a dashing pirate, funny villains, old fashioned swordplay, and True Love. Too bad the ROUS's looked as though they were created by a high school drama group with a $500 budget. But it's like that mole above Cindy Crawford's lip- she's still beautiful, and this movie is still a classic.

An entertaining and adventurous fairy-tale, combined with Reiner's direction, Goldman's script, the performances of the cast, Knopfler's score, Biddle's cinematography, Leighton's editing, Garwood's production design, Gray's set decoration, Dalton's costume design, action sequences and visual effects, The Princess Bride tells a simple yet effective and entertaining story!!!

A modern and satirical look at fairy tales, it mixes fantasy with romance, swashbuckling action, dark comedy, quotable dialogue, intelligent and witty script, and a fresh take on the damsel in distress story.

They don't make movies like The Princess Bride anymore. In fact, I don't think they made films like it before, either. This film is one of a kind. It's an original, engaging story with clever dialogue and a host of engaging characters. The humor is subtle and plentiful, and it's sweetly heart-warming without ever getting too sappy. This is a fantastic tale of fencing, fighting, torture, revenge, giants, monsters, chases, escapes, true love, miracles and everybody should see it. Oh, and if you haven't read the book, you should do that, too.
Inconceivable. I have gone 30 years of my life without watching this movie, somehow.  One of my favorites for sure.
...tell Rotten Tomatoes I loved this Motion Picture ...as you wish‼️
Love this movie! Action...romance...humor! Best of the best
This movie couldn't get any worse! I mean, there were a couple funny parts. "That's incontheiveable!" It is really incontheiveable how predictable parts of this plot is.
Super fun movie but the Princess Buttercup is utterly lame. I liked Billy Crystal's hag much much better. She was awesome!
It's not a bad movie, is just not really good either, not the characters not the story are impressive or interesting.
A classic, and great fun.
The singular most quotable movie of all time!

A marvel of a movie that celebrates, while simultaneously laughing at, the absurdity of fantasy storytelling, managing the near impossible task of equal amounts cynicism and sincerity throughout. The pacing is remarkable, each scene moving breathlessly into the next like an exhaustively choreographed sword fight. Nearly every scene is perfect: wine drinking, Inigo's revenge, Westley's threatening speech to Humperdink, even the framing in Savage's bedroom. One of the greatest children's films ever.

Well well well. What can I say. It's a true treat when I get to discredit, dismantle and destroy one of the world's worst films. The princess bride. That in it self says it. This film is an absolute embarrassment and I cannot recommend it  to anyone of any age. 

Usually I am in agreement with Rotten Tomatoes and their opinions about movies. But when they score The princess bride a 97% and give it a "certified fresh" sticker, It calls into question their entire website and career choice. This film has it all. Poor acting, embarrassing set design, cringe worthy characters, tinny music and a terribly written storyline. Let's first start with the acting. Im imagining the casting session where all the candidates showed up and auditioned and they just picked the worst ones. They acting was nothing like i'd ever seen before. The lines were delivered with less than no emotion. The facial expressions resembled pieces of sour tart fruit. The body language was flaccid and unconvincing. The way the actual movie was portrayed was a disgust to the entire motion picture art. It is a mortification that this movie stands by others. 

Let's now divulge into the actual storyline. The Princess Bride is about a forbidden love story between a princess and a farm boy. Shocking and predictable. I can appreciate where the story was trying to go, poor farm boy going through extreme lengths to get the desirable girl of his dreams. But the cheesy and mediocre rendering of this is why the movie is so bad. The trenching through the forest, the wine test and sword fights. If I ever have to hear the word "inconceivable" said so many times in a row by a fat wrinkled man again I will slam my tongue in a car door. This was an annoying film, which, when studied for an English assignment and made to watch over and over again, became torturous and agitating. I cannot express how notoriously bad this film was. It was very cliche. The poor, up for debate handsome, farm boy charms the princess into being with himself instead of the intended prince bachelor. I think someone dies, though I can't really remember, I don't want to remember.
A fantastic film! Very good acting
This movie is incredible, I can only think of one not so good moment. It is very quotable and amazing
A fine way to pass the time and enjoy a throwback movie. Solid concept, solid execution.
A very nice and simple movie. The more I watched, the more endearing it became.

Tale as old as time...oops wrong movie.

If I had a nickel for every girl I said, "As you wish," to would have one nickel because that girl is my wife.

The classic movie based on a book full of funny life lessons. I can watch this movie anytime. This could be one of the most quoted movies of all time. The acting in this comedy adventure is some of the best out there. You will for sure enjoy the hell out of this one.

This is my favorite movie, ngl. This defined my childhood obsessions: sword fighting, pirates, medieval fantasy. I don't know who I would be without this movie and it never fails to make me smile. It's like a home cooked meal: warm and comforting

The story line of the Grandfather reading his book to his grandson is very heartwarming. The movie is really enjoyable to watch and will have you SHOCKED. I really love this movie and I definitely recommend watching it.
Perfect mix of fantasy, action, adventure, comedy, and romance...as for Carl Elwes, I think he has one of the most beautiful faces I have seen on film! Those blue eyes!!

Absolutely classic film that never gets old. I pretty much know every single line of the film at this point, and the jokes stay fresh even after repeated views. One of the great, all-time Romantic Comedies.

This is one of my favorite movies of all time. Great for kids and adults. It's the best fairy tale movie since The Wizard of Oz.
There is NO remaking this movie that could ever do justice to the wonderful, campy joy of my childhood that this movie is!

More than 30 years ago, audiences were introduced to a movie that has become one of the greatest and most beloved romantic comedies of all time in The Princess Bride.  This cinema classic has stood the test of time.  It's still just as enjoyable today as it was when it originally debuted in theaters in 1987.  Whether one is a fan of the comedy drama or fantasy and romance, The Princess Bride is able to appease audiences of all three genres.  So what is it that makes it such a timeless work?  It all starts with the writing.  It's a simple love story with more than enough romance, sword fighting, and satire to appease both male and female audiences.  Along with the writing, the acting of Cary Elwes and Robin Wright (and their supporting cast) and the directing of Hollywood legend Rob Reiner play their own role in the movie's success.  And now in its 31st year as one of the movie industry's greatest movies, the bonus features included in the latest re-issue make it that much better.  The writing behind The Princess Bride is one of the biggest factors in the success of the movie.  This movie isn't the first time that a movie has ever been adapted from a book.  That the story would actually be told from the book in the movie itself is in itself a funny joke.  [Rob] Reiner doesn't mention anything about this in the additional commentary, but one can't help but laugh at the thought that here is a story being told on screen within the context of a movie that has been adapted from the same book being read to the then very young Fred Savage.  Staying in that same vein, the movie does change a few things here and there.  But for the most part, it makes a valiant effort to stay true to author William Golding's book by the same name.  Knowing this serves to make the movie that much more enjoyable.

The writing behind The Princess Bride is enjoyable as it tries to stay so close to the original book by William Golding.  Add in the acting of an all-star cast and the movie becomes even more enjoyable.  The chemistry and comedic timing of Cary Elwes and his castmates makes for so much laughter throughout the course of the movie's near two hour run time.  Those laughs brought on by the cast's acting are clean laughs.  As Reiner notes in the commentary, it's clean enough for audiences of all ages to enjoy, which is part of the reason for the story's longevity.  Audiences will also thrill at Rob Reiner's comment in the bonus feature, "True Love: The Princess Bride Phenomenon" that no one but Cary Elwes and Robin Wright could play the roles of Wesley and Princess Buttercup.  And audiences will agree with that sentiment, too in watching the new interview included in this new edition.

Reiner's commentary and his sit down with Elwes and Wright add so much more context to the acting and the writing that makes The Princess Bride such a wonderful adaptation.  His sit down with Elwes and Wright are new additions to this newest edition of the classic flick.  Along with it, this edition also culls the special features from the movie's previous DVD releases for the first time.  There's also a new feature title, "Love is Like a Storybook."  It offers a more in depth look at specific elements of the story, making for that much more appreciation for the whole thing.  All combined, the bonus features and the commentary make this classic story that much better.  Add in great acting and equally impressive writing, and it goes without saying that The Princess Bride will continue to be a fan and family favorite for another quarter of a century.

One of my all time faves! Probably seen it two dozen times and it doesn't get "old"; instead, it ages we'll and better than most. A great script, with great lines, delivered by an amazing cast. If you've not seen this one already, you should. And if you have seen it already, you should see it again!

As I did not remember anything about the movie, I've decided to re watch it recently, and to my surprise was a totally different movie. The action part was still there, but I certainly did not remember all the weird "Monty Pythony" kind-of-humor, probably because at that young age, I did not even get it. Weird and cute, even if my pick from that time remains "The Neverending Story".
A classic! Would recommend to anyone! The special effects are somewhat "cringy" but it makes it hilarious. Very witty!
A classic, and a piece of art.
Absolute classic. Worthy of an annual viewing.

It may be campy one minute and epically quotable with it's dry wit the next, but The Princess Bride's heartfelt sincerity in telling a tale "true wuv" (in many forms) is why it stands the test of time. A must watch classic to pass on to generations, but quintessentially rewatchable. Mandy Patinkin's Inigo Montoya is one of my favourite characters of all time. 
May anyone who tries to remake it face The Pit of Despair.

I honestly think that the princess bride was boring they should add more killing seances or fighting seances and I'm not  really into watching older films unless they are older horror films

The movie was great overall I really enjoyed it. A young woman named Buttercup lives on a farm. She eventually realizes that she is mutually in love with the farmhand Westley. He leaves to seek his fortune so they can marry, but his ship is attacked by the Pirates, and Westley is believed dead. Five years later, Buttercup is forced into marriage to the Prince. Before the wedding, she is kidnapped by three outlaws, Vizzini, Fezzik, and Montoya, who seeks revenge against a six-fingered man who killed his father. Then outlaws are pursued by a gay in a black masked who turned out to be Westley. This movie was fun to watch there was exciting scenes it was adventures and etc, and overall a good fairy tale movie to watch and I would highly recommend it.

The Princess Bride is a classic movie with a classic storyline. It's simplicity could either be applauded and appreciated or it could be frowned upon. If you are looking for a nice movie to watch and get a few good laughs in, then this is your movie. If you are looking for a more complex, adventurous movie with a thick storyline, move along. The type of humor that this movie uses is a sarcastic, witty humor with simple lines. 

Don't leave this review believing that this is a bad movie, I am simply explaining its simplicity. The movie starts with a farm boy and a girl falling in love and the farm boy having to leave to make money. The woman is left to believe that her farm boy was killed by the evil pirate. She is forced to move on and marry another man. Before the wedding, she is kidnapped by three men. Her farm boy comes for her rescue in a disguise and takes down the men, one by one. He reveals himself to her and they are finally brought together again. They are trying to escape from the King's men who are trying to find the Princess. They are caught and Wesley is held in a torture chamber. The two men from the beginning of the movie come to help Wesley escape and get the princess back before she marries the King. At the end, Wesley and the Princess are happy together forever. 

I recommend this movie to you if you enjoy a good romantic comedy. Don't watch this movie if you are looking for a crazy, King story.

Fantasy? Comedy? Action? References to annoy your friends with? The Princess Bride has all of these and more, all the while being family friendly and having a loveable cast. A man must fight to save her lover all while a war is raging on. Despite being not much a fan of fantasy movies, this movie blew away my expectations. With Andre the Giant as one of the main characters, this movie is unforgettably good in production quality, with characters and props having a sense of life to them. The only thing I feel this movie lacks in is pacing, but that aside, it's a masterpiece for generations to come.

This movie overall has a great character development that is proceeding to be created through the movie. We find constantly that the characters have clear goals and hopes. It doesn't have extreme unrealistic things. The three characters that we run into have enjoyable personalities. One of the was a swordsman who has a cocky nature and finds himself losing to the protagonist later into the movie. The "leader" is an intellectual that also has a cocky feeling to him, who actually dies due to his intelligence taking over his choices. The last of the three is a giant who is not cocky like the others, but he is not the smartest out of them. He is a great character to add although he might not be the best developed, he does bring light to the other characters. The giant is 100% viable due to his size it wouldn't be surprising in real life. The story started with a farmer boy who later develops to a protagonist for a princess. The protagonist doesn't necessarily have a cocky personality, but he does have a really humble heart, and he does find peace within the rest of the story. The whole story basically revolves around a princess and a lover storyline. That doesn't have a lot of holes, and is very enjoyable. This movie is old but it still satisfies my movie tastes. Overall The Princess Bride is a well developed movie with a great character development that will prove to be one of the best literary adaptations in my books.

A true satisfaction granted to me almost scene by scene. The Princess Bride is a predictable yet enjoyable movie, and although almost every twist and turn was seen by the minds predictions they chose the still entertaining ones. If you are expecting a grand epitome of ideas then this movie is simply not for you, but if you simply want to watch a movie for fun this no look further. The plot follows a basic premise a love story torn apart and brought back together by fate and will. A man who lost his bride, who also happened to be a princes, must  overcome three men. When he does so he finds his love but waits to reveal his identity to her. When he does so they venture off on a sort of reunion trip. The prince whom the princess was supposed to marry finds then and takes the princess away. Seeing the other man as a rival he lies to the princess and takes the man away to a torture dungeon under the castle. The man almost dies but is saved by two of the men from earlier. Together the three storm the castle, defeat the prince, and reunite the princess and her love. The story it's time when it needs to and has many enjoyable confrontations between the characters. The characters you want to die die, and the characters you don't want to don't. My only strife with this film is the weird and unnecessary subplot that takes place in the background between a grandson and his grandfather. The story will pause for a few minutes to show annoying and unwanted banter between the two to display that the whole story is actually just a tale. Overall, if you can take away from it's biggest weakness you can find a good watch. I would recommend this film to anyone with spare time.

This fantasy based classic is one of the best movies of all time. It's a movie that is meant for all ages and can be watched by almost anyone. It's the classic tale of a man saving his woman through many obstacles and challenges. The movie starts with a boy who is playing video games in his bed. His grandfather then comes in and decides to read him a bedtime story. It starts with Wesley having to travel across the sea and the story takes place later with three men kidnapped Buttercup to start a war. As the three men travel with Buttercup Wesley is after them and defeats each man one by one. The story continues as Wesly and Buttercup go through a few obstacles themselves like quicksand and huge, aggressive, possums. They then run into the King and Wesley gets knocked out and placed in a torture basement. Andre the Giant and Inigo take Wesley out of the basement and plan on taking Buttercup back from the King. They do so by causing fear in the first line of defense through Fizzik in a costume on fire. Wesley gets Buttercup back from the king and Inigo gets his revenge on the six fingered man for killing his father. All while taking a throwing knife in the gut. It ends with everyone running off in white horses and everyone lives happily ever after. As the Grandfather finishes the book and leaves the room, the boy asks if he can come back tomorrow to read the book again. 

This adventure filled comedy is a classic to many people including myself. I think the choice of actors is great especially with Andre The Giant portraying a giant with a sensitive side to himself. This movie is filled with comedy scenes, especially when Wesleye outsmarts Vizzini which he then proceeds to knocking out and dying from his cockiness. For most of the movie you do forget that the Grandfather is reading this story to his grandson. This movie is a perfect 5/5 stars, and is very deserving of this rating through the acting and storytelling.

This movie is simply amazing and I have watched it multiple times. The Princess Bride is great in many ways. There is good humor, an interesting story, and a great cast to portray these characters. All these aspects make this movie go above any other fantasy movie I have seen. 
     To start off, the humor is amazing. It always made me either laugh or smile and alway had a great delivery. For a fantasy movie, it was quite funny and I really enjoyed that aspect of the film. 
     The story is also amazing to say the least. It revolves around a man named Westley and a woman named Buttercup. Westley wants to marry this woman, but he can't do that. So he goes away and Buttercup believes that he has died. Little does she know that he is still alive and wants to find her to marry her. He also has to save her from this prince who wants to be with her as well, so he bands together with a giant named Fizziz and a spaniard named Inigo Montoya. They go on a quest to save Buttercup from the prince and must overcome many obstacles. 
     Finally the cast of the movie is great. There are great stand out performances by Andre the Giant and Cary Elwes. The cast work really well together to create a great storyline, deliver great comedic lines and overall, leave a very memorable performance. I would definitely recommend this movie to anyone who has not seen it before.

The Princess Bride. An old film with a story within a story. One simple sweet scenario of a grandpa accompanying his sick grandson by reading him a story. With another story going on in the book grandpa was reading. The storyline of the book is filled with love and princesses and pirates and kidnapping. The sick boy is accompanied by his grandfather who decided to come over and watch him, whilst reading one of his favorite books "The Princess Bride". At first the boy is uninterested and doesn't really want to read the book with his grandfather until his grandfather began reading and the boy got more and more interested as the story escalated. Within that story they were reading, it spoke upon this young couple who was in love and very much head over heels about one another. Until one day, the young man leaves and never returns, leaving the young woman heartbroken and sad. The journey of this double storyline film is engaging, interesting, and very humorous. 

In my opinion, there should've been more scenes of the boy and the grandfather reacting to the scenes of the storyline. Aside from that, the soundtrack and dialogue was well followed through and executed well. Although the effects of the fighting/acting scenes weren't THAT believable, it still entertained me, the audience. 

So to recommend this film? Yes, it is worthy to watch. This film has a family feel to it, meaning it can be watched with children, adults, elders and etc. The storyline within the storyline is eye catching, and the details are specific with a reasonable length of the movie.

The Princess Bride, approved by me. A fun, thrilling, love story film with good dialogue, humor, and a not too slow storyline. The perfect move for just about anybody. Although it is an older film, it still has an engaging feel to it.

This is a good fantasy movie. There are few of those and I know you people reading this review see few good fantasy movies and scream bloody murder but its true. This movie however is good. It is aware of the fact it is a fantasy movie and doesn't try and take itself seriously. It is a fun movie with genuinely funny scenes. The movie is about a princess who gets kidnapped to start a war but is saved by a masked man who turns out to be her lover and plot points later happy ever after yay. 

I enjoyed the movie. It makes fun of the typical fantasy tropes by having the little kid interject saying "wait I thought this is supposed to happen" Which is a very deep commentary about how fantasy movies are so formulaic. Not to mention this movie has a great cast and a great story. 

I recommend this movie to anyone looking for a somewhat special fantasy movie that isn't all formulaic and that bull. This movie is funny and must be watched at least once in your life. It is a must for every human so yea.

This movie is a great movie, Pokes fun at fantasy tropes, and is overall good. It is better than some boring fantasy movie and it has andre the giant. There are cliches but the cliches can get actually decent and the writers poke fun at it. A overall fun a enjoyable movie for all. Please enjoy this movie.

I personally really enjoyed the movie, i am a big fan of these type of fantasy, it is hard for me to be amazed by new fantasy and new world creation. I like to watch classic fantasy. I think it was made very well, considering it was made in 1987 it still entertains people the same way it did in the late 80's, It's a classical, how a poor peasant can win a girl over the king, true love haha, yes we all know that at the ending wesley was going to win her over but the whole story was really funny and entertaining.

The Princess Bride was a nice movie but I wouldn´t say it´s my favorite. I am not a huge fan of fantasy movies which I guess would maybe make me a bit biased for reviewing this but I think I just had very high expectations because of things I had heard about it. I would have to say though that I did like how they made this whole world into a story that is being read by a grandpa to his grandson I thought that was sweet. It was cute to see the transition of the little boy listening to the story going from ew a love story to asking his grandfather if he could come the next day to read it to him again. Some things though that I did not quite love about the movie were the kind of cheesy humor I just was not really amused by and the name of Buttercup being given the princess bride I would have to say kind of threw me off because when her name was first said I thought it was for her horse. I think there were probably a lot better options for the name of a beautiful princess bride than Buttercup. It was a really corny title and I just couldn´t take the scene seriously when they were addressing her with that name. Furthermore, the movie was not bad and I would be willing to give it another shot sometime if a person was a fan of fantasy I think you would most likely enjoy this film a little more than I did.

Truely, wonder tales of such a high quality are scarce and few. All the more reasons to cherish them. And while doing so, do not forget about the superiorority of the dialogues in this particular one. They are like pure gold.
Inconceivably amazing. Fun,  cheeky, well produced and great acting.

Definitely one of the all time greats! Great cast, directing, great love story that you just can't hate. Leaves you on the edge of your seat and you don't know what will happen next! Kid friendly as well, but funny and has a ton of action and adventure.
It's my favorite movie of all time, like ever made including all marvel movies, and the greatest showman (which are also amazing movies as well)!
This is a perfect movie!
I can't understand the appeal of this movie. Aside from the "Battle of Wits" scene, it was bland.

I only just watched this, after reading the book for the first time.
The movie is ok, I don't really understand all the raving reviews though. Perhaps it's because I watched it right after reading the book, but the film is kind of basic - I felt like it didn't capture the true cleverness and satire of the novel and dumbed it down into a typical kid/family movie. I enjoyed the acting though -great cast.
It's as good as it is iconic. I've seen it 100 times and would happily watch it 100 more.

The Princess Bride is a 1987 adventure-comedy directed by Rob Reiner. The film stars Cary Elwes as Westley, Robin Wright as Buttercup, Mandy Patinkin
Inigo Montoya, and André the Giant as Fezzik.

The story was creative and enjoyable, especially from how it was told, but if I had one problem it would be that I wish they focussed on the adventure aspect a little more then they did.

The acting was strong and even at times whimsical, especially Mandy Patinkin's great portrayal of the character Inigo Montoya.

The characters were fun and portrayed well, from Wallace Shawn's extremely entertaining character Vizzini to the persevering character of Inigo Montoya. The only two characters who I found to be a little annoying at times were Buttercup and the grandson, but luckily they didn't distract me from the film that much.

The sets and costumes were very strong and detailed, especially with the look and design of the castle.

The music was steady and filled its purpose, but I do wish that they focused on it a little more instead of just pushing it to the side.

The comedy in my opinion was hands down the strongest aspect of the film, especially the scenes involving the main characters talking to the side characters.

The film I also found to be really entertaining, and I hope to watch it again soon.

Over all I give it a
8/10

"My name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father, prepare to die"

A delightful romance fantasy tale!

Director Rob Reiner's fantasy romance comedy The Princess Bride (1987) is a sweet product of its time. It takes Mark Knopfler's very 1980's style music and a quaint framing device of a grandfather reading a bedtime story to his sick grandson. William Goldman's story is a fun romance drama about true love with a ridiculous comedy style where nonsense happens because it's fun. Reiner's direction is fanciful and fun at all times. The cuts to Peter Falk's narration are neat as is the epic journey within The Princess Bride's brief 98 minute run-time.

Peter Falk is awesome as the kindly grandfather reading to his bratty, yet eager grandson. Fred Savage plays the grandson with a willful ignorance many young boys have that slowly reveals him to be a thoughtful young man that yearns to be more emotionally open. His grandfather teaches a valuable lesson about love, appreciation, and adventure! Falk is one of The Princess Bride's greatest attributes as his portrayal is so gentle, witty, and adoring towards Savage that he endears himself to you immediately. I love Peter Falk as Grandpa in The Princess Bride.

Cary Elwes is wonderful as the heroic Westley. His charm and charisma are dauntless as he effortlessly delivers hilarious dialogue and quirky insults. Robin Wright is lovely and loyal as Princess Buttercup. Her devotion to and chemistry with Elwes is excellent. They play well together.

Mandy Patinkin is riveting as the sword master Inigo Montoya on the hunt for revenge after his father's murder. His fencing duel with Cary Elwes is one of the best in cinema history as is his climactic moment with his foil Christopher Guest's cruel Count Rugen. Their duel is fierce and directed beautifully by Rob Reiner in a serious dramatic way. Montoya is my favorite character in The Princess Bride as you are endeared by his quest and entertained by his compelling performance.

I have to mention Montoya's criminal travelling companions. The lovable Andre the Giant is so quaint as the simple-minded and good-hearted Fezzik. It's cool watching The Princess Bride and seeing this hulking gentle giant have fun with his friends. Wallace Shawn is gut busting as the abusive and arrogant Vizzini. His challenge of the minds with Cary Elwes is perhaps the best writing in the film.

I do not like Chris Sarandon as Prince Humperdinck. He's kind of generic and has less charisma and presence than the other brilliantly cast actors. At least Mel Smith gets a funny cameo as the sadistic Albino. On the other hand of Sarandon is the comedy Billy Crystal as Miracle Max. He gets such a memorable and ridiculous cameo that you cannot forget Crystal as the potion swindling Miracle Max in The Princess Bride. Overall, the cast of the film elevates the comedic to genuine dramatic moments like Montoya's redemption or Elwes' romance with Wright. At the same time, the comedic moments will keep you laughing even though there could be more jokes.

In all, The Princess Bride isn't Rob Reiner's best direction, that would be Stand by Me, nor his best comedy, that would be This Is Spinal Tap; however, The Princess Bride is always a pleasure to watch. It continues to be a dreamy experience of enjoyable fantasy adventure, silly comedy situations, and sweet romantic encounters.
Best film ever. Must see for absolutely everyone

I was always told that this was some sort of huge classic. Like, I was told it was phenomenal, and it was good, but I didn't really enjoy all the decisions from the characters. Like, I've heard snippets of dialogue from it everywhere and I knew there was the Indigo character who wanted to kill the guy who killed his dad but that didn't go how I thought it was gonna go at all! Like, it all seemed like such a forward thinking movie so I expected him to forgive the 6 Fingered Man or something. Like, even the protagonist didn't kill like the main bad guy! Revenge is just, such an ugly character type to have if you're not gonna have the character see how aggressive it is. And like, he was seen as a hero afterward! Some films try to do too many things at once and fail to do any of them properly, distractedly tripping on an extension cord and falling flat on their face. The Princess Bride is a film which tries to do a lot of things and succeeds at all of them. The romance between Buttercup and Wheatley is genuinely effective - I wanted the two characters to end up together, unlike many movie romances where I don't care. The comedy is also effective, in large part thanks to the snappy dialogue - I don't amuse easily, and the scene where Vizzini is trying to guess which glass is poisoned legitimately made me laugh. As an adventure film, The Princess Bride is one of the best I've seen recently, with a fast pace and the occasional well-choreographed action scene such as the duel between Inigo Montoya and the Man in Black. The heroes are even more memorable than the action, with the snarky Wheatley, the honorable, revenge-obsessed swordsman Inigo Montoya, and the bumbling but well-meaning giant Fezzik. My only real criticism of the film is that Buttercup is bland compared to some of the other characters. On a final note, given that many adaptations are criticized for unfaithfulness, this film is as close as possible to the author's vision for an adaptation - William Goldman pushed for a film adaptation of his novel and wrote the film's screenplay himself.

This movie has everything, a little something for everyone, adventure, fantasy, romance, and even MURDER(don't worry that SOB deserved it). First saw this as a child and even though my taste have changed on about everything, this movie stands up against the test of time and still sits proudly atop the heap as my favorite movie.

A movie I grew up with, watching it years later it really is just a fantastic well-rounded adventure film.  The funny thing is noticing as an adult there are some elements that could be questionable, namely that the directing and music can be a bit basic and pedestrian, and there is an overall feeling of camp to a lot of it.  I also never noticed before that the actual plot of the villain is a bit convoluted.  But the thing is, none of that matters.  In fact, it's almost part of the charm.  The comedy works, the adventure works, the sense of fun just works.  The camp is part of the charm, and all you need to know about the story is beat the bad guy and true love conquers all.  It's a great introduction to adventure stories for kids with just a bit of edginess, and watching it years later it's just a damn entertaining movie.
Arguably the best film ever made.
